page.title: 10Fort Widley
page.content: Fort Widley is one of the many forts built by Lord Palmerston on Portsdown Hill. It was built in Fareham red brick by Irish Navvies and finished in 1860. Its purpose was to defend Portsmouth from attack behind Portsdown Hill. From the back of Portsdown Hill the fort is cleverly disguised and looks like a grass mound. It is one of the highest points of Portsmouth and there is a radio communication pylon there. In World War II troups were stationed there. The fort is now a museum and tours are made hourly.There are many underground tunnels, spiral staircases, steep stairs and unfenced drops which make the tour unsuitable for handicapped people and children need to be accompanied by an adult.
